abstract: The attenuated recombinant Vibrio cholerae O1 vaccine strain CVD 103-HgR, re-developed as PXVX0200, elicits a rapid serum vibriocidal antibody (SVA) response and protects against cholera diarrhea in volunteer challenge studies. We performed a phase 3, placebo controlled, double blind, multi-center study to further assess the safety, immunogenicity, and lot-to-lot consistency of PXVX0200. Adult volunteers 18–45 years of age were randomized 8:1 to receive a single dose of 1 × 109 CFU of PXVX0200 from three production lots or saline placebo. Immunogenicity endpoints included SVA and anti-cholera toxin (CT) antibody levels on days 1, 11, 29, 91 and 181. Safety was assessed by comparing solicited signs and symptoms on days 1–8, unsolicited adverse events through day 29 and serious adverse events through day 181. A total of 3146 participants were enrolled, including 2795 vaccine and 351 placebo recipients. The SVA seroconversion rates at day 11 were 94% and 4% in the PXVX0200 and placebo recipients, respectively (P <.0001). Cumulative SVA seroconversion occurred among 96% of vaccine recipients. PXVX0200 SVA GMTs peaked on day 11 and remained significantly higher than placebo through day 181 while the fold-rise over baseline in PXVX0200 anti-CT antibody was significantly greater than placebo at every post-vaccination time point. Most reactogenicity was mild and resolved within 1–3 days with headache and diarrhea more frequently reported in PXVX0200 recipients. There were no differences in unsolicited adverse events and no study-related serious adverse events. Immunogenicity and safety endpoints were equivalent between the three production lots. PXVX0200 is immunogenic and well tolerated across multiple production lots. Clinical Trials Registration: Clinicaltrials.gov NCT02094586.

author_highlights.sentence: Phase 3 live, oral cholera vaccine CVD 103-HgR study in adults age 18–45.
Measured safety, immunogenicity, lot consistency; most reactogenicity mild.
Serum vibriocidal antibody seroconversion rate was 94% 10 days after vaccination.
Vibriocidal antibodies persisted above baseline through 6 months post-vaccination.
Immunogenicity and safety endpoints were equivalent between three production lots.

body_text.sentence: For serum antibody assays, blood was collected from all participants on Days 1 and 11, and additionally from immune sub-study participants on Days 29, 91, and 181.
body_text.title: Study design

body_text.sentence: One severe non-serious AE was considered related to the study product: a vaccine recipient developed severe diarrhea (18 bowel movements in 24 h) on Day 3 which required treatment in an emergency room.
body_text.title: Adverse events

body_text.sentence: The vibriocidal immune response to PXVX0200 is consistent across O1 cholera strains, including classical Inaba, El Tor Inaba, classical Ogawa, and El Tor Ogawa [22].
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: The fold-rise over baseline in anti-CT antibody was significantly greater in PXVX0200 recipients than in placebo recipients at every post-vaccination time point through Day 181 (Fig. 3).
body_text.title: Immune response kinetics

body_text.sentence: The incidence and severity of reactogenicity reported were consistent among all three productions lots.
body_text.title: Safety

body_text.sentence: These results are similar to the vibriocidal antibody seroconversion rates of >90% seen in prior studies and, since vibriocidal antibody has long been known to be a correlate of protection, would be predicted to protect against cholera-induced diarrhea [17–19,23,25,26,37,38].
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: To characterize immune response kinetics over time, SVA and anti-CT antibody were assessed through 6 months-post-vaccination at Days 1, 11 (−3 to +5 days), 29, 91 and 181 (±7 days, each) in the 32 subjects who participated in the immune sub-study.
body_text.title: Immune response kinetics

body_text.sentence: There were 19 SAEs in 17 PXVX0200 recipients (0.6%) and 4 SAEs in 3 placebo recipients (0.9%); none were considered related to the study and all resolved by Day 181.
body_text.title: Adverse events

body_text.sentence: Cumulative vibriocidal seroconversion, defined as a vibriocidal antibody titer at least 4-fold higher than pre-vaccination, occurred in 96% of vaccine recipients and peaked on Day 29.
body_text.title: Discussion

metadata.title: Safety and immunogenicity of single-dose live oral cholera vaccine strain CVD 103-HgR in healthy adults age 18–45
